I voted for Harris, as I always vote for Blue, despite the fact that Blue has done next to nothing to tackle income inequality, to reduce the war machine, to tax the wealthy, or to lift a single finger to fight the last 40 years of encroaching fascism and oligarchy.  I've been a voter for 25 years.  I'm dual income, no kids, college educated, and 42 years old.  I am no closer to owning a home today than I was at 18...if anything, it's WORSE.  It used to be that both parties just squeezed the middle class like trying to get blood from a stone.  The fact that one of those parties just opted to go insane, doesn't change the fact that neither party has done a particularly good job of serving their constituents in my lifetime.  Voting for a Republican may be akin to voting for fascism.  But voting for a Democrat the last several decades still led us to oligarchy.  The fact that liberals continue to blame voters for their failures just signals to me that nothing has changed or will change.  I'll vote for "Not Trump", but I'm under no delusions that things will get better, they're just going to keep getting worse at a slower pace.
